did.unittitle: Collection of East Coast Newsprint on Slavery and Indentured Servitude
did.abstract: This collection includes individual newspaper issues from the East Coast from publications such as The New England Courant, The Boston Gazette, and The National Democrat, as well as one broadside by Gerrit Smith, regarding enslaved persons, slavery, and indentured servants.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized in one series.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: These newspapers were found in the Ryder Collection of Confederate Archives in 2011; the Ryder collection was cataloged as part of the WPA in 1939/1940 but in later decades the catalog (A Calendar of the Ryder Collection of the Confederate Archives at Tufts College 1940) was forgotten and library staff added other materials to the Ryder collection, usually items from the South, from the 18th and 19th century and around the time of the Civil War.

Because the newspapers were not part of the original Ryder collection, items were removed from the Ryder papers (they had been interfiled chronologically). As there is no documentation for this collection, the only shared feature between all of the newsprints is the fact they they all contain advertisement or notes regarding slavery, enslaved persons, or indentured servants -- which is likely the reason they were added to the Ryder collection. The newspapers were brought together into one separate, 'artificial' collection in spring 2012 by Susanne Belovari.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection includes individual newspaper issues from the East Coast from publications such as The New England Courant, The Boston Gazette, and The National Democrat, as well as one broadside by Gerrit Smith, regarding enslaved persons, slavery, and indentured servants.

did.unittitle: Early East Coast newsprint and broadside

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains individual newsprint issues each containing a note or advertisement regarding slavery, enslaved persons, or indentured servants. One document is a broadside by Gerrit Smith regarding slavery and anti-slavery positions in Massachusetts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Page 2 contains advertisement regarding a servant boy, age approximately 16, to be disposed of for four years.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Page 4 includes a note regarding a fugitive 'Scota Man Servant' named James Gall.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Fragile and torn into two pieces, needs restoration. Includes notices regarding West India Rum and 'curled hair mattrass.'

did.unittitle: Old Colonial Memorial and Plymouth County Advertiser

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Newspaper from Plymouth, Mass. Page two includes note on dispute between the United States and the UK regarding restoration of fugitives from slavery.

did.unittitle: The National Democrat, vol.1 new series, no. 87

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Newspaper from Albany, New York. Page 3 includes note offering one cent (sic) reward for a fugitive from indentured servitude, an apprentice named William Rivenburgh.

did.unittitle: Tobacco Herald, and Prince George, Charles, and St. Mary's County Advertiser

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Page one includes several notices regarding rewards for fugitives from slavery identified as: Levin (an approx. 26 year old man), his wife Leath (about 22 years old), John Ridout (about 25 years old), and Bill ('or William') who escaped from Anno Arundel county jail.
